metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26691 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Security Update 2022-003 Catalina, macOS Monterey 12.3, macOS Big Sur 11.6.5. An application may be able to gain elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9').
